newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft earns record $614 million in quarter.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft earns record $614 million in quarter.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. said Monday it earned a record $614 million in its fiscal first quarter as strong demand for its Windows 95 and Windows NT computer operating systems helped fuel record sales.
The earnings meant income of 95 cents a share and came on revenue of $2.30 billion. A year earlier, Microsoft earned $499 million, or 78 cents a share, on revenue of $2.02 billion.
Its income exceeded market expectations. Analysts had expected Microsoft to earn 90 cents a share, according to the average of estimates compiled by First Call.

"This quarter, the company posted solid results across a wide range of businesses, including operating systems, personal productivity tools, and enterprise solutions," said Mike Brown, Chief Financial Officer.
Jeff Raikes, group vice president, sales and marketing. said corporate customers adopted Windows NT servers and workstations in record numbers.
Microsoft closed Monday at $134, down 75 cents a share, on Nasdaq. In after hour trading Microsoft stock jumped $2.375 to $136.375, traders said.
